snippet: Google and the Federal Trade Commission are near a $22.5 million settlement over charges that Google used a loophole in Apple’s Safari browser to show users personalized ads.
abstract: Google and the Federal Trade Commission are near a $22.5 million settlement over charges that Google used a loophole in Apple’s Safari browser to show users personalized ads.

headline.main: Google and F.T.C. Set to Settle Safari Privacy Charge
headline.print_headline: Google Is Said to Accept Fine in F.T.C. Privacy Case
